basics.name: Amol Sood
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced software engineer focused on building scalable, production-ready systems using strong engineering practices and AWS. Brings prior team leadership experience, a hands-on mindset, and close attention to reliability and observability.

work.name: Sciana Health
highlights: Clinical Platform Architecture: Designed and delivered a cloud-native, serverless backend powering nationwide concussion assessments and preventative health checks, translating clinical workflows into a scalable, resilient AWS architecture

Schema-First API Design: Implemented OpenAPI-driven, contract-first APIs to enforce strict data models between a Next.js frontend and decoupled Lambda-based services, enabling predictable integrations and faster clinical feature delivery

Medical Device & Third-Party Integration: Led end-to-end integration with NeuroFlex VR APIs, enabling secure ingestion of diagnostic assessment data and automated generation of clinician-ready, shareable PDF health reports

Event-Driven Healthcare Systems: Built an asynchronous, event-driven microservices ecosystem using EventBridge, SQS, and SNS to reliably orchestrate bookings, patient visits, assessment results, and downstream notifications at scale

Cloud DevOps & Reliability: Established CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure automation for AWS services (API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, S3), supporting rapid iteration while maintaining high availability for mission-critical clinical operations
work.summary: Led the backend engineering of a cloud-native healthcare platform enabling concussion assessments and preventative health checks across clinics in Australia. Owned the end-to-end design and delivery of serverless APIs, event-driven workflows, and secure medical device integrations with NeuroFlex VR. Played a pivotal role in translating clinical and operational requirements into scalable software systems, including automated medical reporting, nationwide booking orchestration, and high-reliability DevOps pipelines, modernizing patient assessment and clinical data flows.

references.reference: I had the pleasure of working with Amol at Stockpile, where he was a key backend engineer on our team. Amol is one of those engineers you can trust to take an idea from nothing and turn it into a production ready system that actually holds up in the real world. Technically, Amol is very strong across the backend stack. He is highly skilled in TypeScript, Node, Java, and both SQL and NoSQL databases, and he consistently applied that knowledge to build reliable, scalable services. He was comfortable owning projects end to end, from initial design and implementation to deployment and ongoing improvements. What really set Amol apart was his ability to communicate. He could explain highly technical concepts clearly to non-technical stakeholders, work closely with product managers to translate requirements into solid technical solutions, and collaborate effectively with external vendors and partners. He was thoughtful, clear, and pragmatic in how he approached tradeoffs and problem solving. Amol was also extremely responsive and dependable. When something needed attention, you could count on him to jump in, follow through, and keep everyone informed. On top of all of that, he was simply a pleasure to have on the team and someone I genuinely enjoyed working with. Any team would be lucky to have Amol, and I would absolutely work with him again. I strongly recommend him for any backend or full-stack engineering role.
references.name: Zachary Zapata, Director of Engineering, Stockpile
